meta.title: COVID-19 - Lackland Independent School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasThreeColumnTopLayout fsSection1240 fsHasTheme2

li.a: Conflict of Interest & Disclosure of Interested Parties
COVID-19 Online Learning and Other Supports
Instructional Continuity Plan for School Closure
Counselors and Social Emotional Support Coordinator
Joint Base San Antonio School Liaison Office
Monitoring Your Child's Progress in Canvas
Free Counseling Resources for Military Families

div.p: Learn more about the district's organizational structure, our achievement data, our leadership, and our special District of Innovation designation
Our district is comprised of two schools, Lackland Elementary and the Virginia Allred Stacey Jr-Sr High School.
The talented professionals working in the various departments throughout our district help to insure our students' success
Our five-member board providers active and supportive leadership to forward the goals of the district.
We deeply appreciate the efforts of our community partners, such as our PTSO, in helping us create educational excellence for our students

img.alt: A Family Poses at PTSO Skate Night

div.p: Information and resources for parents and prospective parents, including military transition assistance

li.a: Monitoring Your Child's Progress in Canvas
Free Counseling Resources for Military Families
Monitoring Your Child's Progress in Canvas
Free Counseling Resources for Military Families

div.p: This page will serve to share information with the district community about the district's responses and efforts with respect to COVID-19. Please bookmark this page for any important updates.

In order to return to school, parents and employees are being asked to complete a Travel Reporting Form to disclose travel during the past 14 days. This form must be completed online no later than Wednesday, March 18, 2020.

li.a: How long has Lackland ISD schools been closed?
How long will the district remain closed?
What was done at Lackland ISD prior to the closure(s) to protect students?
What can I do to help?

h2.a: How long has Lackland ISD schools been closed?

div.p: Lackland ISD closed both Lackland Elementary and Stacey Jr-Sr High School beginning on March 1, 2020.

h2.a: How long will the district remain closed?

div.p: The district continues to remain in touch with local and state health authorities, but the situation is very fluid and predicting a return date is difficult at this time. Texas Governor Greg Abbott has ordered schools closed through May 1, 2020.
School closures are aimed at helping to reduce the pace at which the virus spreads. This, in turn, keeps our local healthcare resources from being overwhelmed.

h2.a: What was done at Lackland ISD prior to the closure(s) to protect students?

div.p: During the cold and flu season, our excellent custodial staff automatically upgrades their efforts to focus on high-contact areas such as door handles as well as common usage areas such as the Media Center. They work hard to keep your child protected from all viruses -- not just COVID-19 -- by sanitizing our common areas each and every day.
Classroom teachers were also provided with disinfectant wipes and spray disinfectants to address any issues that might arise during regular cleanings.

h2.a: What can I do to help?

div.p: You can help us keep your child healthy by following basic prevention techniques and teaching these techniques to your child. These techniques do work on the novel coronavirus. Basic prevention techniques for any virus are:

ul.li: Wash your hands thoroughly and frequently with soap and water, and especially before you eat! (Two rounds of the “Happy Birthday” song.)
Don’t touch your eyes, nose, or mouth until you’ve washed your hands.
Use hand sanitizer when you can’t wash your hands
Keep frequently-touched objects and surfaces clean and disinfected
Avoid close contact with those who are sick

Stay away from others if you’re feeling ill. Children with a fever should stay home from school until their temperature has been normal (less than 100°F per the student handbook) for at least 24 hours without the assistance of medication and their symptoms have improved.

section.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailSmall fsItemCount_5

div.p: Below are all the official notices that have been published by Lackland ISD in response to COVID-19:
Dr. Roper announces the district's decision to close schools for the week of March 16-20

div.p: The Johns Hopkins Center for Systems Science and Engineering has created a live dashboard of COVID-19 cases across the globe.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

article.h2: School Closure Extension Through End of Academic Year

div.p: Texas Governor Greg Abbot has ordered school districts to remain closed through the end of the academic year.
This closure does not impact online instruction, iPad distribution/assistance, or the provision of breakfast and lunch.
Full details and additional information are available on our dedicated COVID-19 page.
